Thessaloniki lies on the crossroads of several major motorways which all connect on the Thessaloniki Inner Ring Road. This is the main route of the city with a speed limit of 90 km/h (56 mph). Like many urban areas, parking in Thessaloniki can prove difficult. Using paid parking lots is a good solution to avoid wasting time looking for parking. From Thessaloniki you are well situated for car rental road trips to many beautiful destinations including the beaches of Chalkidiki.

Thessaloniki is the second largest city in Greece sitting to the north of Athens. There are a number of archeological sites that go as far back as the late second and early third centuries. Important sites include what was the Galerius Maximianus Palace, the Truimphal Arch of Galerius and the Rotunda which is a 4th century building that was later converted into a church. Thessaloniki is also home to the Byzantine monuments which can be compared to an open-air museum. The city also has a number religious landmarks, such as the 7th century Holy Wisdom of God. Other interesting stops to make with your rental car in Thessaloniki include the 15th century White Tower, a major hallmark of the city, the mosques of the Hamza Bey Cami and to the Turkish bathhouses or Hamams.

Not far from Thessaloniki is the beautiful town of Edessa. Here you have easy access to look at the largest waterfalls in the Balkans, the most impressive being Karanos which features a 70 meter drop.

Distance to Edessa Waterfall

From Thessaloniki Airport via E02: 69 miles, about 1 hour and 45 minutes

From Port of Thessaloniki via E02: 65 miles, about 1 hour and 20 minutes

A drive to Meteora from Thessaloniki allows you to explore a fascinating UNESCO World Heritage Site. The six Eastern Orthodox monasteries are built on top of rock pillars and after Mount Athos are the largest and most important. The hike to the complex is not hard but be sure to bring along enough water and a hat to block the sun if making the excursion during the summer months.

Distance to Meteora

From Thessaloniki Airport: 161 miles, about 3 hour and 15 minutes

From Port of Thessaloniki: 141 miles, about 2 hour and 45 minutes
